snippet: The assessment, ordered by police commissioner Raymond W. Kelly, will examine the operations of street narcotics teams, like the one that was involved in the killing of an unarmed Bronx teenager last week.
abstract: New York City Police Commissioner Raymond W Kelly orders an internal review of how police officers conduct low-level narcotics operations, following the fatal shooting of unarmed teenager Ramarley Graham in the Bronx; plainclothes officer who killed Graham was part of a team staking out street locations favored by drug dealers and making arrests after observing hand-to-hand drug sales.
lead_paragraph: The assessment, ordered by police commissioner Raymond W. Kelly, will examine the operations of street narcotics teams, like the one that was involved in the killing of an unarmed Bronx teenager last week.

headline.seo: After Suspect Dies, Kelly Plans Review of Drug Units
headline.main: After Suspect’s Killing, Kelly Orders Review of Drug Units
headline.print_headline: After Suspect’s Killing, Kelly Orders Review of Drug Units
